com.neovisionaries.android.app

Class BottomListActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • android.app.ListActivity
              • com.neovisionaries.android.app.BaseListActivity
                • com.neovisionaries.android.app.BottomListActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class BottomListActivity
extends BaseListActivity
    Base class for Activities that terminate the application when they receive a key down event of KEYCODE_BACK.
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    Takahiko Kawasaki

    • Method Detail

      • onKeyDown

        public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                         android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Call this.exit() if the give key code is KEYCODE_BACK. This means KEYCODE_BACK causes this application to terminate. If the given key code is not KEYCODE_BACK, super.onKeyDown(keyCode, event) is called.
        Specified by:
        onKeyDown in interface android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
        Overrides:
        onKeyDown in class android.app.Activity
